name: Committee on the Administration of Justice
membership: Federation International de Droits des Hommes (FIDH)
memberOrga: We do not have member organisations
goal: CAJ is an independent human rights organisation whose purpose is to ensure that the UK Government fulfils its international obligations under human rights law and standards. CAJ takes no state monies and takes no position on whether Northern Ireland should stay in  the United Kingdom or  join a united Ireland. CAJ was established in 1981 in the middle of the conflict and its main focus is on issues that determine peace or conflict. It sees one of its main priorities as being the defence of the human rights commitments of the 1998 Belfast Good Friday Agreement.
interests: Borders and Security, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives: The main EU theme that CAJ is currently focussed on is the progress of Brexit negotiations. CAJ regards Brexit itself and the particular processes of the negotiations so far as a threat to the peace agreement.
